dialogue.text: I guess the Tooth Fairy didn't want to reveal herself and decided to keep it our secret.
Knowing Mike, he might just knock out his own tooth so he can become a tooth fairy too. Or rather, a tooth guy...?

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Never mind, I'm just kidding.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Oh, okay.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: But I still don't understand why you want a tooth?

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: I just want to put it under my pillow so my parents will put a coin there in the morning, and tomorrow I'll buy us something.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: What, you stopped believing in the tooth fairy too?

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Yes, I think my parents lied to me about him.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Well, now you're wrong.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: You said “he,” not “she,” ahahaha.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: It's so good that you have a friend like me.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Ahahaha... yes, thank you, Mike.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: By the way, why don't you believe in the fairy?

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Because my mom said so, and I don't really trust adults.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Adults like to lie, and I don't like that. And mark my words, I'll never lie.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: I don't know, I trust my parents, they're good people.

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: That's why I'm friends with you, because you're a kid too.

dialogue.name: Noah
dialogue.text: I'm not a kid!!!

dialogue.name: Mike
dialogue.text: Okay, let's go to class.
We sat through all our classes as usual. During every break, Mike would show his teeth in a funny way, then point at me and wink. When it was all over, I went home.
